NutMEG.ecosystem module¶

class NutMEG.ecosystem.ecosystem(r, c, loggerlevel='INFO', dbpath='/Users/pete/github/NutMEG/util/../../NutMEG_db')¶

Bases: object

Class to manage a unique ecosystem, containing some colony or colonies of organisms, and their local environment (reactive system)

c = None¶
check_stopper(stopper_name, orglst, resultsdict, step)¶
empty()¶
output_step_data(step, dicti)¶
predict_growth(tmax=1e+17, volmax=0.99, kmin=1e-23, max_growthrate=1.0, endMF=True, dt=None, factorup=1.01, staticdt=False, quiet=False)¶

Predict how a single colony will evolve in a single environment.

Simulate the colony growing at a self-determined timestep up until one of the passed limters is reached. @param out string containing the name of the output file. @param tmax the maximum time for the simulation to run. Currently just over 1bn yr @param volmax the maximum volume fraction of the vessel the colony

can take up.

@param kmin the slowest rate of respiration to consider. @param endMF whether to close off the simulation when the average

maintenance fraction in the colony exceeds 1.

r = None¶
setup_stoppingdict()¶

NutMEG.ecosystem_dbhelper module¶

class NutMEG.ecosystem_dbhelper.db_helper(e, dbpath)¶

Bases: object

addcolumn(Table, NameType)¶
buildresultsdict()¶
check_summary(notrace=True)¶

Check to see if the simulation you have set up has been performed before.

If it has, a False value and the ID of that simulaiton will be returned. If not, a True value and a Tester ID of a new entry in Summary will be returned.

static create_major_tables(replace=False, dbpath='/Users/pete/github/NutMEG/util/../../NutMEG_db')¶

Create the major tables in the ecosystem database inside the file passsed. If replace is True, any tables of the same name will be deleted.

createtable()¶
dict_to_db(dicti, end=False, finonly=False)¶

Save all info in dictionaries to the database, and refreshs the dictionaries.

static extract_param_db_OrgLoc(OrgIDs, LocID, OrgNums, param, dbpath='/Users/pete/github/NutMEG/util/../../NutMEG_db')¶

Fetch a specific parameter from a simulation, using the relevant OrgID and LocIDs as passed. If the param is a Summary variable, this returns the final value from that simulation., if its one of the others, this returns the full list of results

static extract_param_db_Sim(SimID, param, dbpath='/Users/pete/github/NutMEG/util/../../NutMEG_db')¶

Fetch a specific parameter from a simulation, using its ID as passed. If the param is a Summary variable this returns the final value from that simulation, if its one of the others, this returns the full list of results
